location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter no.91 of 1852, from Captain Arnold Kemball, Acting Resident in the Persian Gulf, to Arthur Malet, Chief Secretary of the Government Bombay

mods.abstract: Letter enclosing an account of sale (f 309) of articles received by Lt-Col Samuel Hennell, Resident in the Persian Gulf, and Kemball, Assistant to the Resident, as presents from the Imam of Muscat and the Governor of Kishm [Qeshm]. The list of gifts received include shawls and a gold sword from the Imam of Muscat, and three bullocks, three sheep, a box sherbet, vermicelli, honey and pumpkins from the Governor of Queshm. Kemball writes that, from the monies received from the sale of these goods, he has made small gifts to the Imam of Muscat's confidential secretary, the Imam's attendant, and the bearer of the gifts from the Governor of Queshm, as acknowledgement of the gifts received.
